issue.title: Feature Request: an option to build one image for multiple envs
issue.body:
Dear jib Team, 

I would like to suggest an option to build one image for multiple envs (dev,prod..), I'm not sure if it's already out there but I just hope for it to be available !

comment.body: also i'm not sure if there's an option to specify when an agent should be running based on environment through the entrypoint !

issue.title: Using extraDirectories.includes in kotlin dsl
issue.body:
Hello! is it possible to use extraDirectories.includes in kotlin dsl?
No matter how i try, i always get unsupported operation exception,

for example
```
                        path {
                            setFrom(file.parentFile)
                            includes.get().add("version.txt")
                            into = "/app"
                        }
```

also, as long as i could see in repository, implementation has only getters and no setters 
my current gradle version is 8.0.2
jib version is 3.4.0

comment.body: FYI, Gradle 8.2 now allows direct assigning: https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/issues/3668#issuecomment-1781232502

issue.title: Missing public setters for private instance variables includes and excludes in ExtraDirectoryParameters for gradle plugin
issue.body:
<!--
Before filing an issue, please reproduce with the latest version of Jib.

If you are encountering errors pulling or pushing to remote registries,
please check our Frequently Asked Questions before filing an issue:

    https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/blob/master/docs/faq.md#registry-errors
-->

**Environment**:

- *Jib version:* 3.2.1
- *Build tool:* Gradle, 7.4.2
- *OS:* N/A

**Description of the issue**:
Public setters are not available for private instance variables `includes` and `excludes` in `com.google.cloud.tools.jib.gradle.ExtraDirectoryParameters`.
See doc: [path](https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/tree/v3.2.1-gradle/jib-gradle-plugin#paths-closure) 

When used in gradle with groovy dsl, it is possible to assign values but it breaks the intended access level.
Using Kotlin-dsl, it is not possible to assign the values (as intended) which breaks the desired functionality.

**Expected behavior**:
Proper public setters should be defined.

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->

comment.body:
It sounds like you are no longer required to use `set()` with Gradle 8.2: https://blog.gradle.org/simpler-kotlin-dsl-property-assignment

> As of Gradle 8.2, it is now possible to use the `=` operator to assign values to `Property` types as a direct alternative to the `set(T)` method in Kotlin DSL scripts.

- *OS:* macos

client = new ApnsClientBuilder()

issue.title: Using extraDirectories.includes in kotlin dsl
issue.body:
Hello! is it possible to use extraDirectories.includes in kotlin dsl?
No matter how i try, i always get unsupported operation exception,

for example
```
                        path {
                            setFrom(file.parentFile)
                            includes.get().add("version.txt")
                            into = "/app"
                        }
```

also, as long as i could see in repository, implementation has only getters and no setters 
my current gradle version is 8.0.2
jib version is 3.4.0

comment.body: @RestfulBlue You might find #3668 relevant to this question! There are no setters in the implementation because they are generated for each `Property` type (Gradle [docs](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/lazy_configuration.html#lazy_properties) for reference) - in Groovy DSL this allows for the assignment (=) operator, but for Kotlin DSL, the `set()` method will need to be used instead.
